lines.text: Enter DOCTOR CAIUS and RUGBY

lines.speaker: doctor caius
lines.text: Jack Rugby!

lines.speaker: rugby
lines.text: Sir

lines.speaker: doctor caius
lines.text: Vat is de clock, Jack

lines.speaker: rugby
lines.text: Tis past the hour, sir, that Sir Hugh promised to meet.

lines.speaker: doctor caius
lines.text: By gar, he has save his soul, dat he is no come he has pray his Pible well, dat he is no come: by gar, Jack Rugby, he is dead already, if he be come.

lines.speaker: rugby
lines.text: He is wise, sir he knew your worship would kill him, if he came.

lines.speaker: doctor caius
lines.text: By gar, de herring is no dead so as I vill kill him. Take your rapier, Jack I vill tell you how I vill kill him.

lines.speaker: rugby
lines.text: Alas, sir, I cannot fence.

lines.speaker: doctor caius
lines.text: Villany, take your rapier.

lines.speaker: rugby
lines.text: Forbear heres company.
Enter Host, SHALLOW, SLENDER, and PAGE

lines.speaker: host
lines.text: Bless thee, bully doctor!

lines.speaker: shallow
lines.text: Save you, Master Doctor Caius!

lines.speaker: page
lines.text: Now, good master doctor!

lines.speaker: slender
lines.text: Give you good morrow, sir.

lines.speaker: doctor caius
lines.text: Vat be all you, one, two, tree, four, come for

lines.speaker: host
lines.text: To see thee fight, to see thee foin, to see thee traverse to see thee here, to see thee there to see thee pass thy punto, thy stock, thy reverse, thy distance, thy montant. Is he dead, my Ethiopian is he dead, my Francisco ha, bully! What says my AEsculapius my Galen my heart of elder ha! is he dead, bully stale is he dead

lines.speaker: doctor caius
lines.text: By gar, he is de coward Jack priest of de vorld he is not show his face.

lines.speaker: host
lines.text: Thou art a CastalionKingUrinal. Hector of Greece, my boy!

lines.speaker: doctor caius
lines.text: I pray you, bear vitness that me have stay six or seven, two, tree hours for him, and he is no come.

lines.speaker: shallow
lines.text: He is the wiser man, master doctor: he is a curer of souls, and you a curer of bodies if you should fight, you go against the hair of your professions. Is it not true, Master Page

lines.speaker: page
lines.text: Master Shallow, you have yourself been a great fighter, though now a man of peace.

lines.speaker: shallow
lines.text: Bodykins, Master Page, though I now be old and of the peace, if I see a sword out, my finger itches to make one. Though we are justices and doctors and churchmen, Master Page, we have some salt of our youth in us we are the sons of women, Master Page.

lines.speaker: page
lines.text: Tis true, Master Shallow.

lines.speaker: shallow
lines.text: It will be found so, Master Page. Master Doctor Caius, I am come to fetch you home. I am sworn of the peace: you have showed yourself a wise physician, and Sir Hugh hath shown himself a wise and patient churchman. You must go with me, master doctor.

lines.speaker: host
lines.text: Pardon, guestjustice. A word, Mounseur Mockwater.

lines.speaker: doctor caius
lines.text: Mockvater! vat is dat

lines.speaker: host
lines.text: Mockwater, in our English tongue, is valour, bully.

lines.speaker: doctor caius
lines.text: By gar, den, I have as mush mockvater as de Englishman. Scurvy jackdog priest! by gar, me vill cut his ears.

lines.speaker: host
lines.text: He will clapperclaw thee tightly, bully.

lines.speaker: doctor caius
lines.text: Clapperdeclaw! vat is dat

lines.speaker: host
lines.text: That is, he will make thee amends.

lines.speaker: doctor caius
lines.text: By gar, me do look he shall clapperdeclaw me for, by gar, me vill have it.

lines.speaker: host
lines.text: And I will provoke him tot, or let him wag.

lines.speaker: doctor caius
lines.text: Me tank you for dat.

lines.speaker: host
lines.text: And, moreover, bully,but first, master guest, and Master Page, and eke Cavaleiro Slender, go you through the town to Frogmore.
Aside to them

lines.speaker: page
lines.text: Sir Hugh is there, is he

lines.speaker: host
lines.text: He is there: see what humour he is in and I will bring the doctor about by the fields. Will it do well

lines.speaker: shallow
lines.text: We will do it.

lines.speaker: slender
lines.text: Adieu, good master doctor.
Exeunt PAGE, SHALLOW, and SLENDER

lines.speaker: doctor caius
lines.text: By gar, me vill kill de priest for he speak for a jackanape to Anne Page.

lines.speaker: host
lines.text: Let him die: sheathe thy impatience, throw cold water on thy choler: go about the fields with me through Frogmore: I will bring thee where Mistress Anne Page is, at a farmhouse afeasting and thou shalt woo her. Cried I aim said I well

lines.speaker: doctor caius
lines.text: By gar, me dank you for dat: by gar, I love you and I shall procurea you de good guest, de earl, de knight, de lords, de gentlemen, my patients.

lines.speaker: host
lines.text: For the which I will be thy adversary toward Anne Page. Said I well

lines.speaker: doctor caius
lines.text: By gar, tis good vell said.

lines.speaker: host
lines.text: Let us wag, then.

lines.speaker: doctor caius
lines.text: Come at my heels, Jack Rugby.
Exeunt
